cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi SE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving NNW, forecast to turn north Tuesday, then N-NE and slow while approaching the west coast of Florida Wednesday–Thursday, crossing the peninsula and emerging into the Atlantic near the northeast/central Florida-Georgia coast late Thursday-Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (near the Tampa Bay–Englewood area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet FL northward to Altamaha Sound GA (includes Canaveral area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for east-central Florida coast; hurricane and storm-surge warnings confined to Florida’s west coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, with greatest wind/surge threat along the west coast; heavy rain and tropical-storm winds expected across east-central Florida including the Space Coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (2–4 ft possible mainly north of Canaveral)
weather_observation.wind: High chance (63%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) with a 16% chance of 50-kt winds; gusts could briefly reach hurricane force if the core tracks just south of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Atlantic surge of 1–3 ft possible; NHC surge watch north of port (Flagler/Volusia line northward) suggests limited but noticeable water-level rise at Port Canaveral.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain expected with localized higher amounts, producing flash and urban flooding potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible beginning late Tuesday; rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents developing Wednesday–Friday.
